content.body: Jeffrey Yasskin: depends, if they're trying to mimic HTML forms with key/value pairs, they should definitely use that
content.formatted_body: Jeffrey Yasskin: depends, if they're trying to mimic HTML forms with key/value pairs, they should definitely use that

content.body: In particular urlencoded is the only standardized format we have for key/value pairs in URLs so it's not even so much about mimicking HTML forms, it's just that if you're going for that semantic you want to use that format.

content.formatted_body:
In reply to @annevk:matrix.org
In particular urlencoded is the only standardized format we have for key/value pairs in URLs so it's not even so much about mimicking HTML forms, it's just that if you're going for that semantic you want to use that format.
Ok, thanks!

content.body: Domenic: is there general guidance for HTML / web platform stuff about when to use options bags arguments vs positional?
content.formatted_body: Domenic: is there general guidance for HTML / web platform stuff about when to use options bags arguments vs positional?

content.body: as a user I am generally happier about options bags because they're easier to read, but we haven't really started leaning in to that
